stem: Перед использованием переносной угловой шлифмашины, какое check — mandatory?

choices.text: Remove the guard to access tight spots
Use any wheel that fits the arbor
Verify the guard — fitted and the wheel RPM rating meets or exceeds tool RPM
Lubricate the wheel with oil for a smoother cut

rationales.C: A properly fitted guard and a wheel rated for the tool speed предотвращает wheel burst.

stem: Что следует сделать, если a электроинструмента’s cord insulation — damaged?

choices.text: Wrap it with tape and continue working
Use it только on GFCI-protected outlets
Tag it out and remove it from service until repaired
Flip the plug to restore the ground

rationales.C: Defective tools must be removed from service and tagged until properly repaired.

stem: Почему следует welding work leads and connections be tight and clean?

choices.text: They уменьшить напряжение drop and overheating at the connections
Smaller cable always saves weight without consequences

rationales.C: Good electrical контактный minimizes resistance, heat buildup, and erratic arc behavior.

stem: Что верно for maintaining an электрод holder?

choices.text: Jaws should be oily to уменьшить sticking
Insulation must be intact and jaws clean with no exposed conductors
Cool the holder in water after heavy use

rationales.C: Sound insulation and clean jaws предотвращает shock and overheating.

stem: Какова рекомендуемая setup angle for a straight лестницы?

choices.text: 4:1 (about 75°) slope from the base to the support
Lean as steep as possible to save space
Lay it nearly horizontal for stability

rationales.B: The 4:1 rule обеспечивает stable footing and proper контактный with the support.

stem: Как влияет строп angle affect tension in a two-leg подъём?

choices.text: Smaller angles уменьшить tension in each leg
Smaller angles увеличивает tension in each leg
Angle has no effect on leg tension

rationales.B: As the angle from horizontal decreases, leg tension rises significantly.

stem: Какое утверждение о кран hand signals — верно?

choices.text: Только the operator may signal a stop
Anyone may give the universal emergency stop signal
Two hands above head always means 'speed up'
There — no standard hand signals for cranes

rationales.B: The emergency stop — universal and may be given by any person observing danger.

stem: Когда the exact weight of a load — unknown, что — the safest approach?

choices.text: Guess the weight by the size of the load
Use rated slings and perform a short, controlled пробный подъём
Ride on the load to watch clearances

rationales.B: A brief пробный подъём lets you verify balance and capacity while staying within control.

stem: Что eye and face protection — appropriate for grinding?

choices.text: Safety glasses and a защитного щитка together
No eye protection for quick touch-ups

rationales.C: Use both защитных очков and a защитного щитка to protect against high-energy debris.

stem: Как долго следует a постового пожарного наблюдателя typically remain after hot work ends?

choices.text: Not required if the area looks clean
A fire extinguisher replaces the постового пожарного наблюдателя

rationales.B: A post-work постового пожарного наблюдателя of ~30 minutes — обычная практика to catch smoldering ignition.

stem: Какое кислород range — considered acceptable for entry into a замкнутого пространства?

choices.text: Any level if wearing a respirator

rationales.B: Atmospheres between ~19.5% and 23.5% кислород — considered acceptable for entry.

stem: After isolating and locking equipment, что should be done before starting work?

choices.text: Remove the locks briefly to test
Attempt a start to verify zero energy
Ask a coworker to avoid touching controls

rationales.B: Verification by attempting a start подтверждает all energy sources — neutralized.

stem: Почему сварочных экранов used around a work area?

choices.text: They только улучшить the welder’s visibility
They protect others from arc flash and flying sparks
They уменьшить fumes below limits by themselves

rationales.B: Screens help shield bystanders from UV radiation and ejected particles.

stem: Какова основная цель a Спецификация сварочного процесса (WPS)?

choices.text: To define essential variables and parameters for production welds
For inspectors только; welders need not read it

rationales.B: The WPS guides the welder with qualified ranges for variables such as ток, положение, and предварительного подогрева.

stem: Какой подход верен когда using чертежей изготовления?

choices.text: Use the latest revision listed in the title block
Let the shop choose per day

rationales.B: Always confirm and work to the ток drawing revision to avoid rework.

stem: Почему apply 5S/бережливого хозяйствования in a welding shop?

choices.text: It уменьшает waste and улучшает safety
It means sweeping at the end of the day только

rationales.B: Orderly workplaces cut search time, trip hazards, and defects.

stem: Какова верная последовательность for organizing a welding job?

choices.text: Start welding, then look for parts
Confirm materials/tools, review WPS & drawings, plan sequence, then set up

rationales.B: Planning with the ток WPS/drawings and confirmed materials предотвращает delays and rework.

stem: Что a калибра для угловых швов measure?

choices.text: Fillet leg size or effective throat

rationales.B: Fillet gauges verify leg length and throat to drawing or code requirements.

stem: Зачем удалять oil, rust, paint, and mill scale before welding?

choices.text: To уменьшить пористости and lack of сплавление

rationales.B: Contaminants cause gas generation and предотвращает сплавление at the interface.

stem: Как следует предварительного подогрева be verified?

choices.text: With temperature-indicating crayons or a thermometer

rationales.B: Use objective temperature indicators to confirm required предварительного подогрева.

stem: Как следует tack welds be placed to control деформации?

choices.text: All tacks on one side of the joint
Balanced around the joint to hold alignment

rationales.B: Balanced, adequate tacks hold fit-up and уменьшить деформации during welding.

stem: Что следует сделать between weld passes with флюс-shielded processes?

choices.text: Water-quench шлак to speed the job

rationales.B: Cleaning between passes предотвращает шлак inclusions and улучшает сплавление.

stem: Что следует сделать at the end of a weld bead?

choices.text: Blend and fill the crater before stopping
Strike a new arc on the finished face

rationales.B: Filling craters снижает риск crater растрескивание.

stem: Как следует power source полярность be chosen?

choices.text: Use the same полярность for all processes
Follow the WPS and consumable manufacturer requirements
Use DCEN (прямая полярность) (прямая полярность) for every job

rationales.B: Different processes and wires/rods require specific полярность for proper сплавление.

stem: Что — the 3-4-5 rule used for in layout?

choices.text: Checking 90° squareness by measuring a 3-4-5 triangle

rationales.B: A 3-4-5 triangle forms a right angle, useful for verifying squareness.

stem: Зачем учитывать cutting kerf in layout?

choices.text: To maintain final dimensions after cutting

rationales.B: Kerf removes material; planning for it preserves required part size.

stem: Зачем использовать a center punch during layout?

choices.text: To preserve hole/mark location during cutting or drilling

rationales.B: Punch marks help keep locations visible and guide drill points.

stem: Как следует a steel rule be read for accuracy?

choices.text: Read to the smallest graduation on the rule

rationales.B: Read the finest graduation available to уменьшить measurement error.

stem: Какой хороший приём for choosing a datum in layout?

choices.text: Select a single clear datum to control accumulated error

rationales.B: A single, consistent datum minimizes tolerance stack-up.

stem: Зачем учитывать bend allowance когда laying out bent parts?

choices.text: Чтобы получить the required finished lengths after bending

rationales.B: Material stretches/compresses in bends; allowing for it preserves sizes.

stem: Какой способ helps transfer equal measurements accurately?

choices.text: Use dividers or a combination square
Use chalk and estimate by eye
Wave a hand near the part

rationales.A: Dividers and squares allow precise transfer of repeated distances.

stem: Как следует precision layout tools be stored?

choices.text: Keep scribes dull and toss squares in a bin
Protect edges and faces to preserve accuracy

rationales.B: Protecting edges maintains the accuracy of rules, squares, and gauges.

stem: Зачем использовать templates or jigs for repeat parts?

choices.text: They speed production and уменьшить measurement error

rationales.B: Templates produce consistent parts and уменьшить layout effort.

stem: Как можно you keep layout lines visible during cutting/fitting?

choices.text: Use contrasting markers or soapstone and refresh as needed
Use permanent paint on all metals

rationales.B: High-contrast marks remain visible through handling and light grinding.

stem: Почему a consistent зазора в корне important before welding a butt joint?

choices.text: It has no effect on проплавление
It helps control проплавление and root сплавление
A completely closed gap — always best
A very large gap предотвращает burn-through

rationales.B: Uniform root gaps help achieve consistent root сплавление without burn-through.

stem: Почему choose a proper угла скоса кромок during prep?

choices.text: The right angle allows access and proper проплавление

rationales.B: Adequate groove angle lets the электрод/torch reach the root and sidewalls.

stem: Какова цель a подкладки (планки)?

choices.text: It supports the root pass and helps предотвращает burn-through

rationales.A: Backing обеспечивает support and can aid complete joint проплавление.

stem: Как можно hi-lo (internal misalignment) be minimized during fit-up?

choices.text: Use clamps, hi-lo tools, and alignment fixtures
Hammer it flush after the weld cools
Rely on weld metal to fill the offset

rationales.B: Proper clamping and alignment tools set parts flush before welding.

stem: Что — the function of стронгбеков (жёстких распорок) during fabrication?

choices.text: They предотвращает деформации and hold alignment while welding

rationales.B: Strongbacks restrain parts to counteract weld shrinkage.

stem: Как следует tack welds be sized?

choices.text: Sized so they can be fused into the final weld

rationales.B: Properly sized tacks fuse into the weld without defects.

stem: Зачем использовать skip or backstep welding sequences?

choices.text: To concentrate heat in one area
To distribute heat and уменьшить деформации
To always weld straight through in one pass

rationales.B: Sequencing spreads heat input and limits деформации.

stem: Что — перемычек-прихваток used for?

rationales.A: Bridge tacks hold edges where gaps exist until proper welding occurs.

stem: Зачем устанавливать планок разгона и сбега?

choices.text: Чтобы получить full сплавление at tie-ins and protect part edges

rationales.B: Tabs allow starting/ending outside the part for complete сплавление.

stem: Как помогают теплоотводящих планок help когда welding thin material?

choices.text: They extract heat to control деформации

rationales.B: Heat sinks pull heat away to limit деформации and burn-through.

stem: Зачем использовать прокладок (шимов) during fit-up?

choices.text: To ensure a consistent root gap когда parts vary

rationales.A: Temporary прокладок (шимов) help set uniform gaps before welding.

stem: Зачем метить part orientation before tacking/welding?

rationales.B: Orientation marks help ensure parts — positioned as designed.

stem: Зачем удалять burrs and oxides from prepared edges?

choices.text: It saves time but уменьшает strength
It улучшает сплавление and уменьшает inclusions

rationales.C: Clean, smooth edges promote full сплавление and fewer inclusions.

stem: Как следует деформации be addressed during fabrication planning?

choices.text: Plan fit and sequence to allow for predicted shrinkage
Clamps cause деформации and should be avoided

rationales.B: Anticipating shrinkage lets you set counter-measures like sequencing and fixturing.

stem: Когда следует fit-up be verified?

choices.text: Before welding — check dimensions, gaps, and angles

rationales.B: Verifying fit-up beforehand предотвращает defects and rework.

stem: Какое правило безопасного использования верно для cut-off wheels?

choices.text: Side-grind with heavy pressure for speed
It — fine with the guard removed

rationales.B: Cut-off wheels — not designed for side loads and can shatter.

stem: Почему paper blotters used between grinding wheel flanges and the wheel?

choices.text: They distribute clamping force and protect the wheel

rationales.B: Blotters cushion and spread load to уменьшить stress concentrations.

stem: Как следует a grinder guard be positioned?

choices.text: Place the guard between the wheel and the operator

rationales.B: The guard should block fragments and direct debris away from the user.

stem: Как следует bonded abrasive wheels be stored?

choices.text: In a damp area to keep cool
Dry, flat, and protected from dropping

rationales.B: Moisture and impacts damage wheels; keep them dry and supported.

stem: Как следует wheel RPM ratings relate to tool RPM?

choices.text: Wheel rating may be below tool speed
Wheel rating must meet or exceed the tool’s maximum RPM
Any mismatch — fine for brief use

rationales.B: A wheel must be rated for at least the tool’s maximum rotational speed.

stem: Какое описание соответствует a neutral кислородно-топливного flame?

choices.text: A balanced inner cone with no feather
An oxidizing feather on the inner cone
A loud, popping flame with backfire

rationales.B: Neutral flame has a well-defined cone and no ацетилен feather.

stem: Какое утверждение о backfire vs flashback — верно?

choices.text: Backfire means flame travels into the hoses
Flashback — flame burning into the torch/hose; backfire — a momentary pop

rationales.B: Backfire — a brief pop at the наконечник; flashback sustains into the torch/hose and — hazardous.

stem: Какой верный приём для piercing a plate with кислородно-топливного?

choices.text: Place the наконечник flat and go to full кислород immediately
Tilt the наконечник, предварительного подогрева, then use the кислород jet to pierce
Point straight down without предварительного подогрева

rationales.B: Preheating and a slight tilt help предотвращает blowback and наконечник damage.

stem: Какое утверждение о кислородно-топливного hose/torch threads — верно?

choices.text: Fuel gas fittings use right-hand threads
Fuel gas fittings use left-hand threads with notches

rationales.B: Fuel gas fittings — left-hand (often with notches); кислород — right-hand to предотвращает mixups.

stem: Что — the верно practice regarding кислород equipment?

choices.text: Никогда не использовать масло/смазку на кислородном оборудовании
not трещина cylinder valves before attaching regulators

rationales.B: Oil/grease can ignite violently in pure кислород.

stem: Какова цель 'растрескивание' cylinder valves briefly before attaching regulators?

choices.text: To blow dust/debris away from the outlet seat

rationales.B: Растрескивание clears contaminants that could damage regulators.

stem: Что — the maximum recommended working pressure for ацетилен?

choices.text: Не использовать ацетилен выше 15 psi (≈103 кПа)

rationales.B: Ацетилен becomes unstable above ~15 psi; keep working pressure below this limit.

stem: Как следует torch standoff be managed in plasma arc cutting (PAC)?

choices.text: Always drag the наконечник regardless of torch design
Maintain the proper standoff/drag per the torch to protect consumables

rationales.B: Верно standoff предотвращает сопло damage and preserves cut quality.

stem: Heavy bottom пригар — usually a sign of что?

rationales.B: Slow travel lets molten metal solidify on the lower edge, forming heavy пригар.

stem: Какая полярность — typical for air plasma cutting systems?

rationales.B: Air plasma torches commonly use DCEN (прямая полярность) (прямая полярность): электрод negative, work positive.

stem: Зачем использовать dry, clean compressed air for PAC?

choices.text: Wet, oily air extends consumable life
Dry, clean air уменьшает wear and улучшает cut quality
Nitrogen — always required instead of air

rationales.B: Moisture and oil contaminate the plasma stream and damage consumables.

stem: Что — the advantage of pilot-arc or HF start in PAC?

choices.text: They require scraping the сопло on the work
They initiate the arc without dragging the сопло
They уменьшить the need for shielding

rationales.B: Non-контактный starts protect the сопло and улучшить reliability.

stem: Какая полярность — standard for air carbon arc gouging (CAC-A) with DC?

rationales.B: DCEP (обратная полярность) (обратная полярность) помогает blow molten metal out of the groove effectively.

stem: Что air supply — required for CAC-A?

choices.text: High-volume, dry air to blow molten metal clear

rationales.B: A high-volume stream of dry compressed air clears molten metal from the groove.

stem: Что — a typical электрод angle for CAC-A?

choices.text: Lead the электрод 15–20° in the travel direction

rationales.B: A small lead angle directs the molten metal out of the gouge.

stem: Какое PPE — most appropriate for CAC-A?

choices.text: Heavy PPE: защитного щитка, hearing protection, leathers

rationales.B: CAC-A — loud and ejects hot metal; robust PPE — required.

stem: Что покрытие type characterizes E7018 электроды?

rationales.B: E7018 — a basic (low-водород), often iron-powder type электрод.

stem: В обозначении E7018 что означает «70»?

rationales.C: The first two digits give the minimum tensile strength in ksi.

stem: Что означает цифра «1» в E7018?

rationales.C: The положение digit '1' means the электрод — usable in all положения.

stem: Какая полярность — commonly used with E6010?

choices.text: AC (переменный ток) или DCEN (прямая полярность) (прямая полярность)

rationales.B: Целлюлозное E6010 typically runs on DCEP (обратная полярность) (обратная полярность) for deep проплавление.

stem: Какой приём — typical for open-root welding with E6010?

choices.text: Fast weave to wash the toes

rationales.B: Whipping controls the keyhole and позволяет root сплавление without excessive burn-through.

stem: Почему следует E7018 электроды be kept in a heated rod oven between uses?

choices.text: To предотвращает moisture pickup and водород растрескивание

rationales.B: Dry storage limits водород pickup that can cause cold растрескивание.

stem: Что arc length — generally recommended for SMAW (ручная дуговая)?

choices.text: Very long arc for better visibility
As short as practical, about the электрод diameter

rationales.B: Short arcs улучшить shielding and уменьшить spatter and подрез.

stem: Какое condition commonly leads to подрез in SMAW (ручная дуговая)?

choices.text: Excessive travel speed or a long arc
Low travel speed with short arc

rationales.A: High speed or long arc washes metal away from the toes, creating подрез.

stem: Как можно arc blow be reduced during SMAW (ручная дуговая)?

choices.text: Lengthen the arc and увеличивает ток
Shorten the arc, move the work lead, or backstep
Switch to a larger электрод только

rationales.B: Short arcs and better return lead placement уменьшить magnetic arc blow.

stem: Зачем удалять шлак between passes with E7018?

choices.text: To avoid шлак inclusions and lack of сплавление

rationales.B: Шлак can become trapped and предотвращает bonding on subsequent beads.

stem: Что — the main benefit of preheating thick or high-strength steel before welding?

choices.text: It уменьшает cooling rate and водород растрескивание risk
It eliminates the need for interpass cleaning

rationales.B: Preheat slows cooling and позволяет водород to diffuse, lowering трещина risk.

stem: Какой хороший приём когда restarting a SMAW (ручная дуговая) bead?

choices.text: Strike on the weld face and continue
Grind/feather the stop and restart slightly ahead to tie in
nothing; the шлак will float out

rationales.B: Feathering and restarting ahead allow blending without defects.

stem: Что — typical angles for a flat углового шва with SMAW (ручная дуговая)?

choices.text: 90° to both pieces with zero travel angle

rationales.A: A 45° work angle with a slight drag/push travel angle — common.

stem: Что problem can damp E7018 электроды cause?

rationales.B: Moisture in the покрытие adds водород to the weld pool.

stem: Какое электрод — best suited for deep-проплавление open-root welding on rusty steel?

rationales.C: Целлюлозное E6010 обеспечивает deep проплавление and tolerance to light surface contamination.

stem: Какие режимы источника питания can E7018 typically run on?

choices.text: DCEP (обратная полярность) (обратная полярность) or AC (переменный ток), per manufacturer
DCEP (обратная полярность) (обратная полярность) только, never AC (переменный ток)

rationales.B: E7018 — usually suitable for DCEP (обратная полярность) (обратная полярность) and often AC (переменный ток) depending on brand/WPS.

stem: Какой приём helps control heat когда welding vertical-up with E7018?

choices.text: Stringer beads (or limited weave) with pauses at the toes

rationales.B: Stringers with brief toe pauses help keep the puddle under control.

stem: Что hazard — associated with welding galvanized steel?

choices.text: No special hazard compared to bare steel
Zinc fumes; remove покрытие locally and ensure ventilation

rationales.B: Zinc fumes — hazardous; remove coatings where possible and ventilate adequately.

stem: Какая полярность — standard for GMAW (MIG/MAG) and most gas-shielded FCAW (порошковая) wires?

rationales.B: Solid and gas-shielded флюс-cored wires typically use электрод positive (DCEP (обратная полярность) (обратная полярность)).

stem: In ER70S-6, что '70' indicate?

rationales.B: Like SMAW (ручная дуговая), the '70' refers to minimum tensile strength in ksi.

stem: Какое shielding gas — commonly used for короткозамыкательного GMAW (MIG/MAG) on carbon steel?

rationales.B: C25 (75/25) обеспечивает stable короткозамыкательного transfer with low spatter.

stem: Чтобы получить струйного переноса on carbon steel, что — generally required?

rationales.B: Струйный transfer needs an аргон-dominant gas and sufficient ток/напряжение.

stem: Increasing напряжение in CV GMAW (MIG/MAG) (at fixed WFS) tends to:

choices.text: Narrow and stiffen the arc with deeper проплавление
Widen the bead and увеличивает wetting
Lower heat input and widen the bead

rationales.B: Higher напряжение broadens the arc column, improving sidewall wetting.

stem: In короткозамыкательного GMAW (MIG/MAG), increasing индуктивность generally:

choices.text: Makes the arc harsher with more spatter
Softens the arc and уменьшает spatter

rationales.B: Greater индуктивность slows ток rise, reducing explosive short clearing.

stem: Что — the effect of excessive вылета проволоки (Ctwd) in GMAW (MIG/MAG)/FCAW (порошковая)?

rationales.B: Long вылет increases resistive heating of the wire, reducing ток at the arc.

stem: Compared with pulling, pushing the GMAW (MIG/MAG) gun typically:

choices.text: Produces deeper проплавление and narrow bead
Produces a wider, flatter bead with slightly less проплавление

rationales.B: Push angles broaden the bead and slightly уменьшить проплавление.

stem: Что often causes 'червоточин (worm tracks)' in FCAW (порошковая)-G deposits?

choices.text: Excessive напряжение/heat or surface contamination causing gas channels

rationales.B: Gas bubbles under the шлак can leave tracks когда напряжение/heat — high or surfaces — dirty.

stem: Что может вызвать пористости in GMAW (MIG/MAG)?

choices.text: Drafts, improper gas flow, or surface contamination

rationales.A: Shielding disruption and contaminants allow gas pores to form.

stem: Какое drive rolls — appropriate for FCAW (порошковая)-S vs solid wire?

choices.text: V-groove for FCAW (порошковая)-S; knurled for solid
Knurled for FCAW (порошковая)-S; V-groove for solid

rationales.B: Knurled rolls grip tubular wire; V-groove rolls suit solid steel wire.

stem: A common cause of 'birdnesting' in GMAW (MIG/MAG) wire feeders — :

choices.text: Incorrect drive-roll tension or liner size causing high drag

rationales.B: Poor feeding due to drag or excessive pressure can tangle the wire at the rolls.

stem: Что typically causes 'burnback' (wire fusing to the токоподводящего наконечника)?

choices.text: Too short вылет or too slow wire feed relative to напряжение

rationales.B: If burnoff exceeds feed, the arc retreats and fuses the наконечник.

stem: Зачем использовать crater-fill or a back-step at the end of a GMAW (MIG/MAG) bead?

choices.text: To уменьшить crater растрескивание and underfill

rationales.B: Filling the crater avoids shrinkage cracks and underfill at the stop.

stem: Какое transfer mode обеспечивает a continuous stream of metal droplets at high ток?

rationales.C: Струйный transfer delivers fine droplets axially across the arc.

stem: Metal-cored (MCAW (металлонаполненная)) wires typically require:

rationales.B: MCAW (металлонаполненная) wires — gas-shielded and need the верно gas mix per spec.

stem: Ограничение режима короткозамыкательного GMAW (MIG/MAG) on thick plate — :

choices.text: Potential lack of сплавление in grooves and fillets
It cannot run out of положение

rationales.C: Low energy per droplet risks lack of сплавление on heavy sections.

stem: Most self-shielded FCAW (порошковая) wires run on:

rationales.A: Popular self-shielded classifications (e.g., E71T-8) use DCEN (прямая полярность) (прямая полярность).

stem: In a CV GMAW (MIG/MAG) system, какое control primarily changes welding ток?

rationales.B: At constant напряжение, increasing WFS raises ток and deposition rate.

stem: Почему keep the GMAW (MIG/MAG) сопло and токоподводящего наконечника clean?

choices.text: To maintain gas coverage and stable electrical контактный

rationales.B: Spatter buildup disturbs shielding and electrical continuity.

stem: Каков типичный эффект increasing travel speed (all else equal)?

rationales.B: Higher travel speed уменьшает heat input, narrowing the bead and проплавление.

stem: Какая полярность — standard for GTAW (TIG) on carbon steel?

rationales.A: DCEN (прямая полярность) (прямая полярность) focuses heat into the work for deep проплавление and protects the tungsten.

stem: Какой тип тока — commonly used for GTAW (TIG) on aluminum?

choices.text: AC (переменный ток) with water as shielding

rationales.B: AC (переменный ток) обеспечивает электрод-positive cleaning action to remove aluminum oxide.

stem: Какова цель a gas lens on a GTAW (TIG) torch?

choices.text: Create laminar gas flow and extend shielding coverage
Allow higher ток on DCEN (прямая полярность) (прямая полярность)

rationales.B: A gas lens straightens flow, improving shielding on joints with more вылет.

stem: Как следует tungsten be ground for GTAW (TIG) on steel?

choices.text: With a blunt chisel наконечник только

rationales.B: Longitudinal grinding directs electrons axially and minimizes arc wander.

stem: Что предотвращает 'sugaring' (oxidation) on the backside of stainless GTAW (TIG) joints?

rationales.B: Inert purge gas shields the backside until the metal cools below oxidation temps.

stem: Какой газ — commonly used for GTAW (TIG) shielding and back purging?

rationales.A: Аргон — inert and widely used for GTAW (TIG) and purging.

stem: Какую классификацию присадки — commonly used for GTAW (TIG) on carbon steel?

rationales.A: ER70S-2 — a deoxidized solid filler rod for GTAW (TIG) on carbon steel.

stem: Increasing the электрод-positive (EP) portion of AC (переменный ток) balance in GTAW (TIG) will:

choices.text: Увеличивает oxide cleaning but heat the tungsten more
Уменьшить cleaning and cool the tungsten

rationales.A: More EP enhances cathodic cleaning while raising tungsten temperature.

stem: К чему может привести чрезмерный GTAW (TIG) shielding gas flow cause?

choices.text: Turbulence that draws in air and contamination

rationales.B: Too much flow creates turbulence and aspiration of air into the shield.

stem: Какой способ поджига GTAW (TIG) avoids tungsten contamination without scraping?

rationales.B: HF or подъём-arc initiates the arc without rubbing the tungsten.

stem: On aluminum GTAW (TIG), что обеспечивает oxide cleaning action?

rationales.B: The EP half-cycle breaks the aluminum oxide film during AC (переменный ток) welding.

stem: Почему choose a larger-diameter tungsten for higher currents?

choices.text: To handle higher heat without melting the наконечник
To avoid the need for filler

rationales.B: Bigger электроды carry more ток without overheating.

stem: Какие положения типичны для submerged arc welding (SAW (под флюсом))?

rationales.B: The granular флюс and high deposition rate suit flat/horizontal welding.

stem: Как следует SAW (под флюсом) флюс be handled to avoid пористости?

choices.text: Keep dry; bake per manufacturer if moisture-contaminated
Mix with oil to bind dust

rationales.B: Moisture in флюс introduces водород and causes пористости; keep флюс dry.

stem: Почему может AC (переменный ток) be used for high-ток SAW (под флюсом)?

choices.text: To уменьшить arc blow and allow higher currents
Because DC cannot make quality welds
To eliminate the need for флюс

rationales.A: Alternating ток уменьшает magnetic arc blow and supports very high currents.

stem: Что SAW (под флюсом) флюс primarily provide?

choices.text: Shielding and шлак formation around the weld pool

rationales.B: Granular флюс supplies shielding, шлак, and sometimes alloying elements.
